author: KarolWes
title: Little craft and nice parts
review:

When I've first seen this set I wondered if I would buy it, if it would be worth it's price. Now I can say that it was.

The ship (which in fact is fought to be one of the ugliest and least fitting in ship in SW) has been captured very well. Color scheme and whole body look is made as good as in the bigger version of her (75188). I like especially the way in which gunners cabins have been designed. They're built using one clear stud and one stud with handle. Biggest disadvantage is that the base of the model is round so it is very unstable and hard to put in right position. Usage of levers as a rear guns is also not a good idea. There are just too long, but I cannot imagine any replacement. Overall model makes a pretty good impression, both in colors and shape.

What about the parts, the most valuable part of the set. We get here 37 bricks for around 3$ (at least in my country). It's fairly resonable price. Bricks are quite interesting: there are e.g. 1x1x1,2/3 with studs on side, and studs with handle, which I've mentioned before. Bricks are mainly in LBG but there are a few ones in blue. Worth noticing is especially 1x1x1 with stud on side in this color.

Unfortunately, most of this parts appears in odd quantity, which happen often in set like this.

Set is little bit higher than a minifig.

Summary:

-> Bricks are nice, valuable, useful, in great colors, but appears in odd quantity.

-> Model looks good enough, is hold in nice color scheme (little bit damaged by grill tile in DBG at the top of model), but very unstable.

-> Price is normal, ~3$ isn't too high.

-> Nice print on a foil pack as an addition.

 

Set if worth buying when you are a collector of all Star Wars / The Last Jedi sets and you want to have all of them, or when you really need those particular parts.
